title: Force
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Force/ko "Force/ko")

- *This article is about the extended command. For the force that sometimes prevents you from teleporting or climbing stairs, see [mysterious force](/wiki/Mysterious_force "Mysterious force").*

**#force** is the [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") to unlock a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") with a [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), either by prying or by smashing the lock. It cannot be used on doors, you will instead get the message "You decide not to force the issue."

Prying with an edged weapon (such as a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")) is a better method, as it will do no harm to the container and its contents. However, it may break your weapon, so do not pry with your only (or best) weapon! Smashing the box with a blunt weapon (such as a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace")) may destroy the whole container, including some or all of its contents. Otherwise, it would be best to leave the container until you have some means of unlocking it. Forcing the chest with an edged weapon exercises dexterity, while a blunt weapon exercises strength.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Mechanics](#Mechanics)

  - [1.1 Weapon breakage](#Weapon_breakage)
  - [1.2 Destroying the container](#Destroying_the_container)

- [2 Variant](#Variant)
  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [3 References](#References)

## Mechanics

Edged weapons are weapons that use any of the following skills: [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar") or [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber").

The per-turn percent chance of success is ![2x+1](/images/math/b/3/d/b3de2049c76972e1b1e957772f908c1d.png), where ![x](/images/math/9/d/d/9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6.png) is the maximum amount of base damage the weapon deals to large monsters.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) For example, a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") deals 1d3 damage to large monsters, so the per-turn chance of success is ![2\*3+1=7%](/images/math/b/1/f/b1fb4e0c676add674a64238a0d09b6a5.png). If you have not succeeded after 50 turns, you give up.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

### Weapon breakage

When forcing open a locked container with an edged weapon, there is a chance the weapon will break, unless it is [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Artifacts will resist breaking 99% of the time. The probability that a non-[artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), [noncursed](/wiki/Noncursed "Noncursed"), edged weapon will survive an unsuccessful attempt to force a locked container is given in the following table, depending on the weapon's [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") and [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") level:[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

| Enchantment | Erosion level |        |             |                   |
| ----------- | ------------- | ------ | ----------- | ----------------- |
|             | Uneroded      | Eroded | Very eroded | Thoroughly eroded |
| +7          | 0.95          | 0.57   | 0.34        | 0.20              |
| +6          | 0.90          | 0.54   | 0.33        | 0.19              |
| +5          | 0.86          | 0.52   | 0.31        | 0.19              |
| +4          | 0.82          | 0.49   | 0.30        | 0.18              |
| +3          | 0.78          | 0.47   | 0.28        | 0.17              |
| +2          | 0.74          | 0.45   | 0.27        | 0.16              |
| +1          | 0.70          | 0.42   | 0.25        | 0.15              |
| +0          | 0.67          | 0.40   | 0.24        | 0.14              |
| -1          | 0.64          | 0.38   | 0.23        | 0.14              |
| -2          | 0.61          | 0.36   | 0.22        | 0.13              |
| -3          | 0.58          | 0.35   | 0.21        | 0.12              |
| -4          | 0.55          | 0.33   | 0.20        | 0.12              |
| -5          | 0.52          | 0.31   | 0.19        | 0.11              |
| -6          | 0.50          | 0.30   | 0.18        | 0.11              |
| -7          | 0.47          | 0.28   | 0.17        | 0.10              |

### Destroying the container

If you successfully force the lock using a blunt weapon, there is a 25% chance that you also destroy the container.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) If you do destroy the container, you will also destroy every potion in the container, and every non-potion in the container has a 25% chance of being destroyed.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Variant

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), you can also use the force command on doors to bash it down with your weapon.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 207](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line207 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *edged weapons exercise dexterity; blunt weapons exercise strength*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 488](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line488 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *success probability depends on the weapon's damage vs. large monsters*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 139](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line139 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *give up after 50 turns*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 149](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line149 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *cursed weapons won't break*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 148](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line148 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *whether an edged weapon breaks depends on its enchantment and erosion*
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 168](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line168 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *containers forced with blunt weapons destroyed 25% of the time*
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 182](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/lock.c#line182 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/lock.c"): *contents of a destroyed container have 25% chance (or 100% for potions) of being destroyed*

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Force

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

This article is about the extended command. For the force that sometimes prevents you from teleporting or climbing stairs, see mysterious force.

#force is the extended command to unlock a container with a weapon, either by prying or by smashing the lock. It cannot be used on doors, you will instead get the message "You decide not to force the issue."

Prying with an edged weapon (such as a dagger) is a better method, as it will do no harm to the container and its contents. However, it may break your weapon, so do not pry with your only (or best) weapon! Smashing the box with a blunt weapon (such as a mace) may destroy the whole container, including some or all of its contents. Otherwise, it would be best to leave the container until you have some means of unlocking it. Forcing the chest with an edged weapon exercises dexterity, while a blunt weapon exercises strength.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Mechanics
    • 1.1 Weapon breakage
    • 1.2 Destroying the container
  • 2 Variant
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
  • 3 References

Mechanics

Edged weapons are weapons that use any of the following skills: dagger, knife, axe, short sword, broadsword, long sword, two-handed sword, scimitar or saber.

The per-turn percent chance of success is , where is the maximum amount of base damage the weapon deals to large monsters.[2] For example, a dagger deals 1d3 damage to large monsters, so the per-turn chance of success is . If you have not succeeded after 50 turns, you give up.[3]

Weapon breakage

When forcing open a locked container with an edged weapon, there is a chance the weapon will break, unless it is cursed.[4] Artifacts will resist breaking 99% of the time. The probability that a non-artifact, noncursed, edged weapon will survive an unsuccessful attempt to force a locked container is given in the following table, depending on the weapon's enchantment and erosion level:[5]

Enchantment Erosion level
Uneroded Eroded Very eroded Thoroughly eroded
+7 0.95 0.57 0.34 0.20
+6 0.90 0.54 0.33 0.19
+5 0.86 0.52 0.31 0.19
+4 0.82 0.49 0.30 0.18
+3 0.78 0.47 0.28 0.17
+2 0.74 0.45 0.27 0.16
+1 0.70 0.42 0.25 0.15
+0 0.67 0.40 0.24 0.14
-1 0.64 0.38 0.23 0.14
-2 0.61 0.36 0.22 0.13
-3 0.58 0.35 0.21 0.12
-4 0.55 0.33 0.20 0.12
-5 0.52 0.31 0.19 0.11
-6 0.50 0.30 0.18 0.11
-7 0.47 0.28 0.17 0.10

Destroying the container

If you successfully force the lock using a blunt weapon, there is a 25% chance that you also destroy the container.[6] If you do destroy the container, you will also destroy every potion in the container, and every non-potion in the container has a 25% chance of being destroyed.[7]

Variant

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, you can also use the force command on doors to bash it down with your weapon.

References

  1. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 207: edged weapons exercise dexterity; blunt weapons exercise strength
  2. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 488: success probability depends on the weapon's damage vs. large monsters
  3. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 139: give up after 50 turns
  4. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 149: cursed weapons won't break
  5. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 148: whether an edged weapon breaks depends on its enchantment and erosion
  6. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 168: containers forced with blunt weapons destroyed 25% of the time
  7. ↑ lock.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 182: contents of a destroyed container have 25% chance (or 100% for potions) of being destroyed

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

{{languages}}
{{otheruses|the extended command|the force that sometimes prevents you from teleporting or climbing stairs|mysterious force}}

'''#force''' is the [[extended command]] to unlock a [[container]] with a [[weapon]], either by prying or by smashing the lock.  It cannot be used on doors, you will instead get the message "You decide not to force the issue."

Prying with an edged weapon (such as a [[dagger]]) is a better method, as it will do no harm to the container and its contents. However, it may break your weapon, so do not pry with your only (or best) weapon! Smashing the box with a blunt weapon (such as a [[mace]]) may destroy the whole container, including some or all of its contents. Otherwise, it would be best to leave the container until you have some means of unlocking it. Forcing the chest with an edged weapon exercises dexterity, while a blunt weapon exercises strength.{{refsrc|lock.c|207|comment=edged weapons exercise dexterity; blunt weapons exercise strength}}

==Mechanics==
Edged weapons are weapons that use any of the following skills: [[dagger]], [[knife]], [[axe]], [[short sword]], [[broadsword]], [[long sword]], [[two-handed sword]], [[scimitar]] or [[saber]].

The per-turn percent chance of success is <math>2x+1</math>, where <math>x</math> is the maximum amount of base damage the weapon deals to large monsters.{{refsrc|lock.c|488|comment=success probability depends on the weapon's damage vs. large monsters}} For example, a [[dagger]] deals 1d3 damage to large monsters, so the per-turn chance of success is <math>2*3+1=7%</math>. If you have not succeeded after 50 turns, you give up.{{refsrc|lock.c|139|comment=give up after 50 turns}}

===Weapon breakage===
When forcing open a locked container with an edged weapon, there is a chance the weapon will break, unless it is [[cursed]].{{refsrc|lock.c|149|comment=cursed weapons won't break}} Artifacts will resist breaking 99% of the time. The probability that a non-[[artifact]], [[noncursed]], edged weapon will survive an unsuccessful attempt to force a locked container is given in the following table, depending on the weapon's [[enchantment]] and [[erosion]] level:{{refsrc|lock.c|148|comment=whether an edged weapon breaks depends on its enchantment and erosion}}
<!-- Formula for this table: ((992-10*Erosion)/(1000-Enchantment))^50 -->

===Destroying the container===
If you successfully force the lock using a blunt weapon, there is a 25% chance that you also destroy the container.{{refsrc|lock.c|168|comment=containers forced with blunt weapons destroyed 25% of the time}} If you do destroy the container, you will also destroy every potion in the container, and every non-potion in the container has a 25% chance of being destroyed.{{refsrc|lock.c|182|comment=contents of a destroyed container have 25% chance (or 100% for potions) of being destroyed}}

==Variant==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], you can also use the force command on doors to bash it down with your weapon.
